intro: Buddleja domingensis, commonly known as the royal weeping buddleia, is a shrub native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its long, drooping clusters of fragrant, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of purple and pink. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are opposite and often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sun. Buddleja domingensis is popular in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators like butterflies and hummingbirds.
